answers.answer: I have it also, I have to check my blood four times a day. And eat less sugary foods. Your placenta is blocking your insulin flow. Chances are you might have a large baby but I don't see y you couldn't have a water birth.

I had diabetes for both my pregnancies.  For my second I wanted to have a water birth, but they wouldn't let me.  Anyway, turned out I needed a cesarian (nothing to do with diabetes, which was very well managed), but because she got tied in the umbilical cord.I still dream of having a water birth.I think it will depend on your dr / the hospital.
